intro: Clidemia elegans, commonly known as silverleaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. Clidemia elegans is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and bloom.
